snippet: The company said it earned $310 million for the period ended Dec. 31, up from $259 million a year ago.
abstract: Lorillard says its net income grew nearly 20 percent in the fourth quarter as it sold more cigarettes at higher prices; earnings were $310 million, or $2.32 a share, for the period, up from $259 million, or $1.74 a share, a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The company said it earned $310 million for the period ended Dec. 31, up from $259 million a year ago.
